mentions.context: Besides the seminal MapReduce framework [16], which is not suitable for iterative computations on the same data, one can mention Apache Spark [26], Apache Flink [10] and the machine learning-oriented Petuum [25].
Some striking examples are Apache Spark [26] and Petuum [25], the latter being fully targeted to machine learning.
For instance, the repartition method in Apache Spark relies on a deterministic shuffle which preserves the size of the partitions.
Some striking examples are Apache Spark [26] and Petuum [25], the latter being fully targeted to machine learning.

In these frameworks, the data is typically first read from a distributed file system (such as HDFS, Hadoop Distributed File System) and partitioned across the memory of each machine in the form of an appropriate distributed data structure.

Besides the seminal MapReduce framework [16], which is not suitable for iterative computations on the same data, one can mention Apache Spark [26], Apache Flink [10] and the machine learning-oriented Petuum [25].
